page.title: 01HORKESLEYS AND BOXTED
page.content: This area is in Essex with the northern part just going into Suffolk. The county border line is the River Stour.The whole area is rich in agricultural land with a variety of crops being grown.These include cereal crops,fruit growing, particularly apples, tomatoes, sugar beet and vegetables. Little Horkesley is a small village which has not changed very much over the years.The population is 290.Great Horkesley is a larger village which has developed to the south,nearer to Colchester,in recent years.It has a population of 2080.The older part of the village and the Parish Church lie to the north,closer to Nayland.Boxted lies to the north east of the area and some house building has taken place in recent years.The population is 1465.
